space.arim.universal.registry

Class UniversalRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • space.arim.universal.registry.UniversalRegistry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Registry

    public final class UniversalRegistry
extends Object
implements Registry
    UniversalRegistry: Main class

    Used for retrieving Registry instances:
    * get()
    * getByClass(Class)
    * threadLocal()
    * getOrDefault(Class, Supplier)
    Author:
    A248

      • threadLocal

        public static ThreadLocal<Registry> threadLocal()
        Registry instances are thread safe; however, you may wish for a thread specific instance nonetheless.
        Returns:
        ThreadLocal a ThreadLocal

      • getByClass

        public static Registry getByClass(Class<?> clazz)
        Retrieves a Registry instance by class. If no instance for the classname exists, a new one is created.

        This is the preferred approach to using your own UniversalRegistry instances.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class
        Returns:
        the instance. If none exists, a new instance is created.

      • getOrDefault

        public static Registry getOrDefault(Class<?> clazz,
                                    Supplier<Registry> defaultSupplier)
        Gets a Registry instance by class with a default value, issued by the Supplier, if it does not exist.

        This method is useful for checking for a specific instance and falling back to a default value.
        Parameters:
        clazz - see getByClass(Class)
        defaultSupplier - from which to return back default values.
        Returns:
        the instance if it exists, otherwise the default value

      • get

        public static Registry get()
        Gets the main instance of UniversalRegistry
        Returns:
        the instance

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Returns the id of this Registry instance.
        This method is purposefully not exposed since it is not part of the officially supported API.
        Returns:
        String the id

      • getEvents

        public Events getEvents()
        Description copied from interface: Registry
        Gets the Events instance corresponding to this registry.

        The returned Events instance is the same one on which RegistrationEvents are fired.
        Specified by:
        getEvents in interface Registry
        Returns:
        Events the accompanying events instance

      • register

        public <T extends Registrable> T register(Class<T> service,
                                          T provider)
        Description copied from interface: Registry
        Attempts to register a resource as a specific service.
        * If there is a registration for the service which has a higher priority, nothing happens.
        * Otherwise, the resource is registered for the service.
        Specified by:
        register in interface Registry
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service
        Parameters:
        service - the service class, e.g. Economy.class for Vault economy
        provider - the resource to register, cannot be null
        Returns:
        the resulting registration (after a possible update)

      • compute

        public <T extends Registrable> T compute(Class<T> service,
                                         byte priority,
                                         Supplier<T> computer)
        Description copied from interface: Registry
        Attempts to register a resource as a specific service.
        Differs from Registry.register(Class, Registrable) in that the other method always requires a preconstructed object. Since the object may be discarded, it is a potential misuse of resources to create and object only to discard it. Thus, this method is provided as a solution. This way, creating the resource is only necessary if the existing registration has a lower priority than the priority parameter.
        Specified by:
        compute in interface Registry
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service
        Parameters:
        service - the service class, e.g. Economy.class for Vault economy
        priority - the priority of the resource which will be registered
        computer - the Supplier which, if queried for its object, will provide the resource to register
        Returns:
        the resulting registration (after a possible update)

      • computeIfAbsent

        public <T extends Registrable> T computeIfAbsent(Class<T> service,
                                                 Supplier<T> computer)
        Description copied from interface: Registry
        Registers a resource conditionally:
        * If there is a registration for the service, it is returned.
        * Otherwise, the resource provided by the Supplier is registered and returned.

        Functions similarly to Map.computeIfAbsent(Object, java.util.function.Function).
        Specified by:
        computeIfAbsent in interface Registry
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service
        Parameters:
        service - the service class
        computer - if there is no registration for the service, the resource is demanded from this Supplier
        Returns:
        the registration for the service once the operation is complete

      • isProvidedFor

        public <T extends Registrable> boolean isProvidedFor(Class<T> service)
        Description copied from interface: Registry
        Checks whether a service has any accompanying provider

        This method should only be called in the rare case where you need to check whether a service is registered but you do not need to retrieve the registration itself.

        If you need to retrive a registration use Registry.getRegistration(Class)
        Specified by:
        isProvidedFor in interface Registry
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service
        Parameters:
        service - the service class
        Returns:
        true if the service is provided for, false if not

      • getRegistration

        public <T extends Registrable> T getRegistration(Class<T> service)
        Description copied from interface: Registry
        Retrieves the highest-priority registration for a service.

        The proper way to retrieve registrations is to call this method once, check if the returned value is non-null. If not null, proceed normally. If null, there is no registration for the service. (You could then print an explanatory error message)

        Do not use Registry.isProvidedFor(Class) and then this method, or you may experience concurrency problems.
        Specified by:
        getRegistration in interface Registry
        Type Parameters:
        T - the service
        Parameters:
        service - the service class
        Returns:
        the service asked.

      • getRegistrations

        public Map<Class<?>,Registrable> getRegistrations()
        Description copied from interface: Registry
        Retrieves a the map of service types to registrations backed by the internal registry.

        Changes to the internal registry are reflected in the map
        Specified by:
        getRegistrations in interface Registry
        Returns:
        a map of service classes to registrable lists
